DOC.brief_title: The Effects Single-dose Rectal Midazolam Application Post-operative Recovery
DOC.detailed_description: Summary Background : This study aim compare efficiency rectal midazolam addition apply bupivacaine caudal anesthesia postoperative analgesia time , need additional analgesic , postoperative recovery , sedation , find adverse effect child low abdominal surgery . Methods : 40 child 2 10 year American Society Anesthesiologist ( ASA ) I-II stage randomize applied caudal anesthesia general anesthesia . Patients apply caudal block addition saline 1milliliter/kilograms ( mL/kg ) bupivacaine 0.25 % . In postoperative period , Group C ( n=20 ) give 5 milliliter ( mL ) saline Group M ( n=20 ) give 0.30 mg/kg rectal midazolam dilute 5mL saline . Sedation scale postoperative pain scale ( CHIPPS ) patient evaluate . The patient observe analgesic need , first analgesic time , adverse effect 24 hour .
